repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

msContents.summary: Text of the Saundaryalaharīvyākhyāna attributed to Śaṅkara and Lakṣmīdharā commentary. Text and commentary in Sanskrit. This manuscript should logically have been attributed a shelfmark 'Sanscrit' rather than 'Indien' in the BnF collection.

support.p: Different types of papers: thiner for U1, f93-f95.

collation.desc: the front cover. Selfmark on the verso.
1 folio = front guard leaf. No foliation. Shelfmarks on the recto. Verso blank.
2 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso.
95 folios = main text. Original Tamil pagination: 1-129, 1 unpaginated page, 130-188. Parallel Arabic library foliation 1-95.
2 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso.

supportDesc.condition: Relatively good state of preservation. The binding is partly unbound.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker Indien 500 (verso of front cover).
BnF Shelfmarks Tam. 500 in black ink and Tamoul N° 500 in black pencil (f[1]r).
BnF stamps BIBLIOTHÈQUE IMPÉRIALE MSS. (U1, f1r and f95r) and DON N° (U1, f1r).
Stamp SOCIÉTÉ ASIATIQUE DON COLLECTION ARIEL (U1, f1r).
Corrections in later black ink. Crossed-out portions.

binding.p: Leather (brown) covers. Title and decoration on the spine.

origin.origDate: Earlier than 1855, since part of the bequest by Édouard Ariel (as attested by stamp on U1, f1r) received in 1855 by the Société Asiatique. Written by Rāmasvāli Śāstrin in the year Parābhava of the Jovian cycle, that is, most probably CE 1846-1847.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 70.

Saundaryalaharī 1958. The Saundaryalaharī or Flood of Beauty. Traditionally ascribed to Sankarācārya. Edited, translated and presented in photographs by W. Norman Brown. Harvard University Press: Cambridge (Harvard Oriental Series 43).
Saundaryalaharī 1976. Saundaryalaharī of Śrī Śaṅkara Bhagavatpādācarya with Commentaries (in Sanskrit) Lakṣmīdharā, [etc.]. Edited by A. Kuppuswami. Madras.
Rosny, Léon de (1868). “La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry.” In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
